intro: Didelotia afzelii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and come in shades of yellow to orange. The plant is notable for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
